outreach.subject: Quick sanity check: 2–4 week decision‑support prototype for seat & AI‑credit choices
outreach.draft_v1: Figma’s multiple seat types (Collab, Dev, Full) and tiered AI‑credit model create recurring, quantifiable decisions for org admins — yet it’s unclear which admin APIs expose seat and credit usage. I propose a low‑risk, 2–4 week decision‑support prototype for Org Admins: an explainable recommender that ingests team usage (seats, feature adoption, AI‑credit burn) and outputs prioritized actions (seat reallocations, plan changes, AI‑credit purchases) with cost and 6–12 week impact forecasts. We’d build it as an offline prototype using exports or sandboxed data and deliver an interactive report plus click‑through admin UI. Can we do a 15‑minute sanity‑check call to confirm data access and KPIs?
outreach.draft_v2: Your Dev Mode/MCP features and the platform’s design‑system controls suggest two practical decision levers: developer seat allocation and library governance — yet I don’t know if per‑team usage and AI‑credit metrics are available via APIs. My suggested low‑risk prototype (2–4 weeks) builds a small decision agent for Design Ops: it analyzes exported usage, simulates 2–3 scenarios (seat mix, plan upgrade, credit top‑up), and produces ranked recommendations with estimated costs and expected time‑to‑value. Deliverables: interactive scenario tool plus brief playbook for Ops. Interested in a 15‑minute call to verify data availability and agree success metrics?
personalization_points: Reference to multiple seat types (Collab, Dev, Full) and AI‑credit model as concrete decision points
Mention of Dev Mode / MCP and design‑system controls as places where in‑flow support could sit
Target stakeholders: Org Admin / Design Ops / Head of Product as likely owners
assumptions_or_unknowns: Availability of admin/usage APIs or ability to export per‑team seat and AI‑credit consumption
Enterprise privacy, permissions, and policy constraints for in‑app agent prototypes
Exact granularity of AI features and credit accounting exposed to admins
